meanings.definition: A person or animal that uses their paws.
meanings.sent1: The playful kitten was one of the best pawers in the litter.
meanings.sent2: The bear and the raccoon are skilled pawers in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The pawers at the zoo put on a cute show for the visitors.
meanings.sent4: Watching the squirrel gather nuts, I admired its skills as a pawer.
meanings.sent5: The little girl giggled as she imitated the pawers at the petting zoo.

meanings.definition: Those who have the ability to manipulate or handle things with their paws.
meanings.sent1: The monkeys in the jungle are known as clever pawers.
meanings.sent2: The skilled pawers at the circus amazed the audience with their tricks.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon was a sneaky pawer, always getting into trouble.
meanings.sent4: The skilled pawers delicately picked up the fragile objects without breaking them.
meanings.sent5: The bear was a powerful pawer, able to move heavy logs effortlessly.
